page.title: 05Lochnager Distillery
page.content: The Duke of Gordon built the distillery at the beginning of the 19th century. It was rebuilt by John Begg in 1820 after a fire. There are 12 people employed. There is a brewer, secretary, cleaner, cooper, 2 mashmen, 3 stillmen,a tractor man, and a man who does anything. My dad is the Customs and Excise man also known as 'the gauger'. In the distillery there are two dams which are used for the making of the whisky. Inside the stillhouse there is a glass case and it shows you how to make whisky. Next year there are plans to open a Visitors' Centre. There are 4 or more warehouses which my dad locks up. When the bottles were sold in square boxes it said 'Lochnager 12 years Young'. My dad does the VAT and goes to Braemar, Ballater, Tarland etc. A whisky lorry comes on Monday and Thursday.
